title.narrative: ISS, Institute for Security Studies, kärnstöd 2017-2021

description.narrative: The Institute for Security Studies (ISS), based in South Africa, is a Pan-African think tank and training provider aiming to advance human security in Africa through evidence-based policy advice, technical support and capacity building.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: Core support covers all different thematic and geographic areas where ISS is active. In 2017, ISS inter alia achieved the following ("Outcomes report, Jan.-Dec. 2017): observed and assessed AU Peace and Security initatives, including the "Silencing-the-Guns"-initative, published findings in its PSC Report; trained journalists and communication officers in the Lake Chad Basin; supported policy research on peace and security for young researchers in West Africa; provided policy advice on the Sahel to actors in the region; worked with IGAD and the AU on developing strategies and charters for maritime security; worked with IGAD and ECOWAS to research and understand issues related to migration and security, including human smuggling, the links/the lack of links between migration and violent extremism; supported the AMISOM to develop a standardized training programme for police in peace operations; and supported the Pan-African Parliament to further include youth in its work, notably the role of youth in governance, peacebuilding, peace and security.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
